result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Cash bond is set in the amount of $8,000 (per case). If the defendant posts cash bail, the defendant must report to and comply with Pretrial Services. NONCOMPLIANCE WILL BE REPORTED BY DCPS TO THE JUDICIARY WHO SHALL RESPOND IN ONE OF THESE WAYS: Schedule bail hearing, Increase Supervision, Issue warrant, No change but monitor.

Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Jason Carlos Gonzalez.  Kyle Olsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Gonzalez filed a motion to modify bond-reduce cash bail. Br. 5

Attorney Jason Carlos Gonzalez in court for Defendant Demorris Xavier Posley. Prosecuting Atty Colleen Lennon appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Demorris Xavier Posley appeared by video means in custody. Due to courtroom technical difficulties, audio for DE not working. Atty. Gonzalez objects to setover, moves to dismiss without prejudice if hearing cannot be held. Court responds, attempts to connect audio; successfully connects audio. Court addresses identification due to poor video quality/ ability for DE to confer with counsel privately. Atty. Gonzalez exits courtroom, joins hearing via zoom. Court grants parties time to discuss identification stipulation off the record. Back on the record, DE states objection to setover. Parties proceed to preliminary hearing. State moves to finds counts 1-2 transactionally related. DE objects, waives argument. Court finds counts 1-2 to be transactionally related. Officer J. C. duly sworn and testified. Atty. Lennon with direct. Witness identified DE via video means. Atty. Gonzalez with cross. Atty. Lennon with redirect. State moves for bindover, reserves argument. DE objects, waives argument. Court finds PC for bindover to branch.
Atty Gonzalez
